question: My father-in-law will be having an angiogram this Friday.  If he ends up having to have bypass surgery, I am wondering what his chances are.  I have seen many, many people have bypass surgery.  Many people (friends, relatives, co-workers) I know have had bypass surgery and were diabetic.  None of them survived because of their diabetes.  Wondering how many members out there or members relatives and friends have had bypass surgery that were diabetic and survived?  I know heart surgeons around here tell everyone that they have a 1 in 5 chance of not surviving, but that is everyone even young people with no diabetes.  Any information will be helpful.  Thank you.
title: Open Heart Surgery for Diabetics
